derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: probably shortening of dialect maggot the pie, maggoty-pie, from Magot (Middle English pet form of the given name Marguerite) + pie

entry.def: A magpie is a large black and white bird with a long tail.

entry.tran: 爱收集（无价值物品）的人;爱收藏（破烂）的人
entry.def: If you describe someone as a magpie, you mean that they like collecting and keeping things, often things that have little value.

example.ex: A born magpie, Mandy collects any object that catches her eye.
example.tran: 曼迪天生喜欢收集小玩意，只要是她看上的都会收藏起来。

means.word_mean: 1. long-tailed black-and-white bird that utters a chattering call
2. someone who collects things that have been discarded by others
3. an obnoxious and foolish and loquacious talker
